threat: A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause PHP to crash, leading to a denial of service.
A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause a denial of service, or to perform a directory traversal attack.
A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to bypass authentication.
A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to bypass authentication.
This could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code running with the privilege of the web server, or to perform a denial of service.
A remote attacker could use this flaw to perform a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.
